Package gbssg.Jamalia_Polat_Vrlec

Class Vector

java.lang.Object
gbssg.Jamalia_Polat_Vrlec.Vector
Direct Known Subclasses:
Vector2D, Vector3D
public abstract class Vector extends Object
This class is a blueprint of a vector.
Version:
1.0
Author:
Filip Vrlec, Serkan Polat, Moiz Jamalia

  • Method Details

    • getError

      public int getError()

    • add

      public static Vector add(Vector a, Vector b)
      This static method is used to add two different vectors and to return the vector. This method relies on the abstract method add.
      Parameters:
      a - the vector which uses the add method from the respective class
      b - is added to the vector a
      Returns:
      the result as vector a

    • add

      public abstract void add(Vector a)
      This abstract method is a method which has to be implemented in the child classes. This method will add a vector to the current vector.
      Parameters:
      a - is added to the current object

    • sub

      public static Vector sub(Vector a, Vector b)
      This static method is used to subtract two different vectors and to return the vector. This method relies on the abstract method sub.
      Parameters:
      a - the vector which uses the sub method from the respective class
      b - the vector which is used to subtract
      Returns:
      the result as vector a

    • sub

      public abstract void sub(Vector a)
      This abstract method is a method which has to be implemented in the child classes. This method will subtract a vector from the current vector.
      Parameters:
      a - is a vector which is used to subtract from the current object

    • mult

      public static Vector mult(Vector a, double k)
      This static method is used to multiply a vector with a double. This method relies on the abstract method 'mult'.
      Parameters:
      a - the vector which is being multiplied
      k - the double which is used for multiplying
      Returns:
      the vector a as a result

    • mult

      public abstract void mult(double k)
      This abstract method is a method which has to be implemented in the child classes. This method will multiply the current vector with a double.
      Parameters:
      k - is a double which is used to multiply the current object vector

    • amount

      public static double amount(Vector a)
      This static method is used to calculate the amount of the vector. It is calculated by the usage of the Pythagorean theorem.
      Parameters:
      a - is the vector of which amount will be calculated
      Returns:
      the result as a double

    • amount

      public abstract double amount()
      This abstract method is a method which has to be implemented in the child classes. This method will be used to calculate the amount of a vector.
      Returns:
      the amount as a double

    • isEqual

      public static boolean isEqual(Vector a, Vector b)
      This is a method which compares one vector to another. This method relies on the abstract method amount.
      Parameters:
      a - is vector to which the other vector will be compared to
      b - is the other vector
      Returns:
      a boolean which says if the two vectors are equal

    • isEqual

      public abstract boolean isEqual(Vector a)
      This abstract method is a method which has to be implemented in the child classes.
      Parameters:
      a - is a vector to which the current object will be compared to
      Returns:
      a boolean which says if the two vectors are equal

    • invert

      public abstract void invert()
      This abstract method is a method which has to be implemented in the child classes. It will be used to invert the vector.

    • isInverse

      public abstract boolean isInverse(Vector a)
      This abstract method is a method which has to be implemented in the child classes. It will be used to check if the vector a is inverted.
      Parameters:
      a - is the vector
      Returns:
      a boolean

    • isNullVector

      public abstract boolean isNullVector()
      This abstract method is a method which has to be implemented in the child classes. It will be used to check if the vector is a null vector.
      Returns:
      a boolean

    • isUnitVector

      public boolean isUnitVector()
      This method is a method which checks if the amount of the calculated Unit vector is equal 1.
      Returns:
      a boolean

    • asUnitVector

      public abstract Vector asUnitVector()
      This abstract method is a method which has to be implemented in the child classes. It will be used to convert the vector to a unit vector.
      Returns:
      vector
